intro: Ceriscoides curranii, commonly known as the Curran's cerisia, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces numerous tiny florets clustered in dense heads. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
